document_data.mainbody:
ibiscus were hardy flowers from which tea could be made.
These flowering plants could be found in Halruaa, the mountains of Chessenta, and Zakhara.
Hibiscus were sometimes used as decorative flowers. They were cultivated in the Public Gardens of the City of Delights in Zakhara alongside roses and similar blooms.
A spicy hibiscus tea was said to be widely popular in Chessenta as of the late 15 century DR.
